intro: Klasea sogdiana, commonly known as the Sogdian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
